message_1:
Here's a numerical problem for a student studying temporal logic in mathematics:

Suppose the statement P(t) denotes "it is currently raining," and the statement Q(t) denotes "it will be sunny in two hours." Using temporal logic, write a logical statement that is true if it is currently raining and it will be sunny in two hours.

Solution: 
Using the temporal operator "after" and "and", we can form the statement as:

P(t) and Q(t+2)

Find the truth value of this statement given the current time t.
message_2: To find the truth value of the statement P(t) and Q(t+2) given the current time t, we need information about the weather conditions at time t and time t+2. Without this information, we cannot determine the truth value of the statement. Please provide the weather conditions at time t and time t+2.
